question: What is a structure in C language.?
option1: A) A structure is a collection of elements that can be of same data type.
option2: B) A structure is a collection of elements that can be of different data type.
option3: C) Elements of a structure are called members.

question: What is the size of a C structure.?
option1: A) C structure is always 128 bytes.
option2: B) Size of C structure is the total bytes of all elements of structure.
option3: C) Size of C structure is the size of largest element.

question: Choose a correct statement about C structures.
option1: A) Structure elements can be initialized at the time of declaration.
option2: B) Structure members can not be initialized at the time of declaration
option3: C) Only integer members of structure can be initialized at the time of declaraion

option1: A) It is wrong to define an empty structure
option2: B) Member variables can be added to a structure even after its first definition.
option3: C) There is no use of defining an empty structure

question: Choose a correct statement about C structure elements.?
option1: A) Structure elements are stored on random free memory locations
option2: B) structure elements are stored in register memory locations
option3: C) structure elements are stored in contiguous memory locations

question: A C Structure or User defined data type is also called.?
What are the uses of C Structures.?
option1: A) structure is used to implement Linked Lists, Stack and Queue data structures
option2: B) Structures are used in Operating System functionality like Display and Input taking.
option3: C) Structure are used to exchange information with peripherals of PC

question: Choose a correct statement about C structures.
option1: A) A structure can contain same structure type member.
option2: B) A structure size is limited by only physical memory of that PC.
option3: C) You can define an unlimited number of members inside a structure.
